@description.name: @description
@description.body: A class file is parsed and anaysed into an instance of ClassFile; it is connected to the Analyser that found the class so that dependencies can be identified.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Constructor

@param.name: @param
@param.body: analyser {Analyser} the Analyser that found the file
@param.description: the Analyser that found the file

@param.name: @param
@param.body: className {String} the full name of the class
@param.description: the full name of the class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
library {Library} the Library the class belongs to (note that the class name is
  not always enough to identify the library, eg private source files such as qxWeb.js)
@param.description:
the Library the class belongs to (note that the class name is
  not always enough to identify the library, eg private source files such as qxWeb.js)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the absolute path to the class file

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {string}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the path to the rewritten class file

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {string}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Loads the source, transpiles and analyses the code, storing the result in outputPath

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
callback
          {Function} callback for when the load is completed
@param.description: callback for when the load is completed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Writes the data for the database; updates the record, which may have been previously used (so needs to be zero'd out)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: dbClassInfo {Map}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Compiles the DbInfo POJO to be stored in the database about this class

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the loaded meta data

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Babel plugin

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Pushes new meta data onto the stack - each meta represents a class being defined, we operate a stack so that we can handle inner classes

@param.name: @param
@param.body: className {String} name of the class being defined
@param.description: name of the class being defined

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Pops the current meta off the stack, optionally checking that the classname is correct

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Pushes a new scope on the stack

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Pops a scope from the stack

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Tests whether the current scope is load-time scope

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Tests whether this class has a defer method

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a variable declaration to the current scope; if the symbol was previously "unresolved" it is removed from the unresolved list

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} the name of the variabvle being declared
@param.description: the name of the variabvle being declared

@param.name: @param
@param.body: valueName {String} the value to assign to the variable
@param.description: the value to assign to the variable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Tests whether there is a variable declaration accessible to the current scope, ie including parent scope

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a reference to a symbol; unknown symbols are marked as unresolved

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name

@param.name: @param
@param.body: loc

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Repeatably encodes a private symbol name, caching the result; ignores non-private symbols

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} symbol name
@param.description: symbol name

@param.name: @param
@param.body: isIdentifier {boolean} whether this is usage as an identifier (and not in a string literal)
@param.description: whether this is usage as an identifier (and not in a string literal)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: location {Location} the location of the symbol
@param.description: the location of the symbol

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} the encoded name if private, the original name if not private
@return.description: the encoded name if private, the original name if not private

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes a reference from scope; this should only really be used after scanning is complete

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds an external resource which needs to be loaded early

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} name of the symbol
@param.description: name of the symbol

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a CommonJS module to be browserified

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} name of the module
@param.description: name of the module

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds an ignored symbol

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} name of the symbol
@param.description: name of the symbol

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Tests whether a symbol has already been marked as ignore

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} symbol name
@param.description: symbol name

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if ignored
@return.description: true if ignored

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an ignored symbol

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} name of the symbol
@param.description: name of the symbol

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds an environment check made by the class

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name

@param.name: @param
@param.body: location {Object?} see _requireClass
@param.description: see _requireClass

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a marker (eg warning or error)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msgId {String} the marker message ID (@see qx.tool.compiler.Marker)
@param.description: the marker message ID (@see qx.tool.compiler.Marker)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
pos {Object||null} position map; may contain a Map containing
  {line,column?}, or a Map {start:{line,column}, end: {line,column}}.
@param.description:
position map; may contain a Map containing
  {line,column?}, or a Map {start:{line,column}, end: {line,column}}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a required class

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} the name of the class
@param.description: the name of the class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
opts {Map?} which is:
  where {"ignore"|"require"|"use"|null} where it's mentioned
  load {Boolean?} whether it is a load-time dependency or not
  defer {Boolean?} whether the dependency is in defer or not
  location {Map?} location of the token that caused the reference
@param.description:
which is:
  where {"ignore"|"require"|"use"|null} where it's mentioned
  load {Boolean?} whether it is a load-time dependency or not
  defer {Boolean?} whether the dependency is in defer or not
  location {Map?} location of the token that caused the reference

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map?} info about the symbol type of the named class, @see {Analyser.getSymbolType}
@return.description: info about the symbol type of the named class, @see {Analyser.getSymbolType}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a required asset

@param.name: @param
@param.body: path

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the assets required by the class

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Finds an object property in a node tree (not a Qooxdoo property, an object property)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: props

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the list of required classes (dependencies)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a list of unresolved symbols

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the name of the class being compiled

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {null}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The bind method delegates the call to the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} function. As source, the current object (this) will be used.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
sourcePropertyChain {String} The property chain which represents
   the source property.
@param.description:
The property chain which represents
   the source property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetObject {qx.core.Object} The object which the source should
   be bind to.
@param.description:
The object which the source should
   be bind to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
targetProperty {String?"value"} The property name of the target object,
   defaults to "value".
@param.description:
The property name of the target object,
   defaults to "value".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
options {Map?null} A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.
@param.description:
A map containing the options. See
   {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding#bind} for more
   information.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{var} Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
   for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
   id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.
@return.description:
Returns the internal id for that binding. This can be used
   for referencing the binding e.g. for removing. This is not an atomic
   id so you can't you use it as a hash-map index.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).
@throws.description:
If the event is no data event or
   there is no property definition for object and property (source and
   target).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes the binding with the given id from the current object. The id has to be the id returned by any of the bind functions.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {var} The id of the binding.
@param.description: The id of the binding.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the binding could not be found.
@throws.description: If the binding could not be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings between the object and the related one.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
relatedObject {qx.core.Object} The object of which related
   bindings should be removed.
@param.description:
The object of which related
   bindings should be removed.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.
@throws.description:
If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes all bindings from the object.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{qx.core.AssertionError} If the object is not in the internal
   registry of the bindings.
@throws.description:
If the object is not in the internal
   registry of the bindings.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.
@throws.description:
If one of the bindings listed internally can not be
   removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array which lists all bindings for the object.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Array} An array of binding informations. Every binding
   information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
   targetObject and targetProperty in that order.
@return.description:
An array of binding informations. Every binding
   information is an array itself containing id, sourceObject, sourceEvent,
   targetObject and targetProperty in that order.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a debug message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an info message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs a warning message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Logs an error message with the current stack trace

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
varargs {var} The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.
@param.description:
The item(s) to log. Any number of arguments is
 supported. If an argument is not a string, the object dump will be
 logged.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper that calls the appropriate logger function with the current object and any number of items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: level {String} The log level of the message
@param.description: The log level of the message

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varargs {arguments} Arguments list to be logged
@param.description: Arguments list to be logged

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object ? null} Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.
@param.description:
Reference to the 'this' variable inside
         the event listener. When not given, the corresponding dispatcher
         usually falls back to a default, which is the target
         by convention. Note this is not a strict requirement, i.e.
         custom dispatchers can follow a different strategy.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add event listener to this object, which is only called once. After the listener is called the event listener gets removed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: context {Object ? window} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.
@param.description:
Whether to attach the event to the
         capturing phase or the bubbling phase of the event. The default is
         to attach the event handler to the bubbling phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String} An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
@return.description:
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener
         using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove event listener from this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body: listener {Function} event callback function
@param.description: event callback function

@param.name: @param
@param.body: self {Object ? null} reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback
@param.description: reference to the 'this' variable inside the callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean} Whether to remove the event listener of
   the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to remove the event listener of
   the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an event listener from an event target by an id returned by {@link #addListener}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id returned by {@link #addListener}
@param.description: The id returned by {@link #addListener}

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)
@return.description: Whether the event was removed successfully (has existed)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check if there are one or more listeners for an event type.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} name of the event type
@param.description: name of the event type

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
capture {Boolean ? false} Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
@param.description:
Whether to check for listeners of
         the bubbling or of the capturing phase.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the object has a listener of the given type.
@return.description: Whether the object has a listener of the given type.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispatch an event on this object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: evt {qx.event.type.Event} event to dispatch
@param.description: event to dispatch

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal helper method to track promises returned from event handlers

@param.name: @param
@param.body: {var} result the result from the event handler
@param.description: the result from the event handler

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise|var} the value to return
@return.description: the value to return

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Waits for all pending events to be resolved

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an event on this object; equivalent to fireEvent, except that it always returns a promise

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected
@return.description:
a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create an event object and dispatch it on this object. The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean} Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
Whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create an event object and dispatch it on this object; equivalent to fireNonBubblingEvent, except that it always returns a promise. The event dispatched with this method does never bubble! Use only if you are sure that bubbling is not required.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: clazz {Class?qx.event.type.Event} The event class
@param.description: The event class

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
args {Array?null} Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.
@param.description:
Arguments, which will be passed to
       the event's init method.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected
@return.description:
a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)
@param.description: The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Boolean|qx.Promise} whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.
@return.description:
whether the event default was prevented or not.
     Returns true, when the event was NOT prevented.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates and dispatches an non-bubbling data event on this object; equivalent to fireEvent, except that it always returns a promise.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: type {String} Event type to fire
@param.description: Event type to fire

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {var} User defined data attached to the event object
@param.description: User defined data attached to the event object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: oldData {var?null} The event's old data (optional)
@param.description: The event's old data (optional)

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link qx.event.type.Event#preventDefault}

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.Promise} a promise aggregated from the event handlers;
  if the default was prevented, the promise is rejected

a promise aggregated from the event handlers;

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets either multiple properties at once by using a property list or sets one property and its value by the first and second argument. As a fallback, if no generated property setter could be found, a handwritten setter will be searched and invoked if available.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: data {Object | String} a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.
@param.description: a map of property values. The key is the name of the property.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: value {var?} the value, only used when data is a string.
@param.description: the value, only used when data is a string.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Object} Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.
@return.description: Returns this instance if data is a map or a non-generated setter is called; otherwise returns value.

@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the value of the given property. If no generated getter could be found, a fallback tries to access a handwritten getter.

@param.description: Name of the property.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The value of the value
@return.description: The value of the value

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist
@throws.description: if a property defined does not exist

@param.description: Name of the property.

@throws.body: {Error} if a property defined does not exist

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the object and adds it to a list; most classes are expected to override _createQxObjectImpl NOT this method.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the created object
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the object, intended to be overridden. Null is a valid return value and will be cached by getQxObject, however undefined is NOT a valid value and so will not be cached meaning that _createQxObjectImpl will be called multiple times until a valid value is returned.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} ID of the object
@param.description: ID of the object

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.core.Object?} the created object
@return.description: the created object

@description.name: @description

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String?} the id to set when registering the object
@param.description: the id to set when registering the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Discards an object from the list of owned objects; note that this does not dispose of the object, simply forgets it if it exists.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: args {String|Object} the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself
@param.description: the ID of the object to discard, or the object itself

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes an owned object

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {qx.core.Object} the object
@param.description: the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of objects that are owned by this object, or an empty array if none exists.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: These options are passed to Babel for JSX compilation; they can be changed by the CLI etc as needed. Note that at the moment they use a class that does not exist! qx.html.Jsx is coming soon to a PR near you, but in the mean time you could use the compile.json jsx setting to change these to something else, eg { pragma: "jsx.dom", pragmaFrag: "jsx.Fragment } and use https://github.com/alecsgone/jsx-render in your application's code.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Classes which are safe to access from defer methods (in addition to the class being defined)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: List of global symbols to be ignored

@description.name: @description
@description.body: These are the constants which are answered by Qooxdoo qx.core.Environment; we use out own copy here and not the one available in qx.core.Environment._defaults because we need to use the version which is appropriate for the version of Qooxdoo being compiled, not the one that this CLI is compiled with
